title: [Neuroscience] Parkinson's Disease patients could walk properly again with brainstem Deep Brain Stimulation treatment, says scientists behind new study. Activation of neurons in the pedunculopontine nucleus was sufficient to restore full movement function in mice with symptoms of the disease (Nature Communication)

[Neuroscience] Research discusses mechanisms of how non-neuronal cells in limbic regions of brain interface at synapses, the neurovascular unit, and other sites of intercellular communication to mediate the deleterious, or adaptive effects of chronic stress in rodent models and in human stress-related disorders
